>Darren can correct me if I'm wrong, but if I recall correctly this
>solution was accidentally evolved with recurrency turned off!

I did one successfully with recurrency off (by accident, as you said), then
another with it turned on, which hit 100% after 1590 generations. I also
tried an experiment in which, instead of a discrete grid, a continuous space
was examined where the shape was defined by a function rather than a bitmap.
The best network I got reached 93% success after 2890 generations before
stagnating. It's possible, had I run the experiment longer, NEAT would
eventually have achieved 100%, but I wanted to draw the line somewhere!

--Darren
